column5: Hey All,  With all the rain/ warm weather i thought it was appropriate to get out this weekend and hit my fav. trib. 4am came early, loaded up the car and headed north. Picked up a friend from work who has never fished for steelhead in his life.  Hooked him up w/ a rod ,reel and smokes and he was on his way. We got there at the break of dawn, super high dirty water greeted us when we arrived (expected) but it was still nice to get a line wet. Unfortunatly we had a time limit. 12pm..... In the 5 Hour span we brought in 2 fish... enjoy!  B with his first ever steelhead 6lbs 3 oz.. (the pictures were not taken on my camera, they were on B's camera -- so these are pics are pics of the pics he took..sheesh!)   me with my steelie 9 lbs 8oz   Was a good day for 5 hours of fishing considering the conditions...  Joe

Wow!  Great setting and even better fish!  I waited for the updated pics before commenting.  There's something about catching these guys in the rivers on a cold winters day.  Hooking them, and the adrenaline that follows keeps you warm even on the coldest days.  Great job out there guys.
congrats on a couple nice ones
Nice fish bud, the water looks mint.
~~~~~Great post bud fantastic pics, and you still owe me a coffee
I second that. Water looks awesome! Thanks for sharing  p.-
Nice steelies!!! Well done! Congrats to your buddy on his first bow!
